zone.line: with respect to it - Ion. Certainly not. Soc. With reference
To re return to the verses which you just recited. - Do think you
think that you or a charioteer would be better capable
of deciding whether Homer had spoken rightly or not? —
Ion Doubtless a charioteer - Soc. For you are a rhapsodist
And
-dist & not a charioteer. Ion. Yes. Soc. For the art
of reciting verses is different from that of driving
chariots? Ion. Certainly. Soc. And if it is different
it supposes a knowledge of different things. Ion. Certainly.
Soc. And when Homer introduces Herc Ecamede the
concubine of Nestor giving Mochaon who was wounded
a pop posset to drink, & speaking he speaks thus
Does it belong to the medical or the rhapsodical
art to determine whether Homer speaks rightly on
this subject. Ion. To the medical. Soc. And
when he says
does it belong to the rhapsodical or the piscatorial
art to determine whether he speaks rightly or
not r respecting on the subject. Ion Manifestly to
